bib.title: Unraveling the genetic elements involved in shoot and root growth regulation by jasmonate in rice using a genome-wide association study
bib.author: Huong Thi Mai To and Hieu Trang Nguyen and Nguyet Thi Minh Dang and Ngan Huyen Nguyen and Thai Xuan Bui and Jérémy Lavarenne and Nhung Thi Phuong Phung and Pascal Gantet and Michel Lebrun and Stephane Bellafiore and Antony Champion
bib.abstract: Due to their sessile life style, plant survival is dependent on the ability to build up fast and highly adapted responses to environmental stresses by modulating defense response and organ growth. The phytohormone jasmonate plays an essential role in regulating these plant responses to stress.To assess variation of plant growth responses and identify genetic determinants associated to JA treatment, we conducted a genome-wide association study (GWAS) using an original panel of Vietnamese rice accessions. The phenotyping results showed a high natural genetic variability of the 155 tested rice accessions in response to JA for shoot and root growth.
